SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.gensym.jgi
Class G2Gateway

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.gensym.jgi.G2Gateway
public class G2Gateway
extends Object
implements G2Connection

This class provides a network interface to a GSI-INTERFACE object created within a connected G2.

A G2Gateway can communicate with a G2 once a connection has been established. The G2Gateway can create the connection using the methods getOrMakeConnection, initiateConnection or wait for a G2 server to make the connection.

There are three distinct ways of communicating with G2;

1.Simple Messages : send messages to G2's message board (returnMessage) and Receive a message from G2 (g2MessageReceived in G2ConnectionListener)

2.Remote Procedure Calls : Registered Java Methods (registerJavaMethod) can be called by G2 and G2 procedures/methods that can be called by a G2Gateway. G2 procedures and methods can be called Synchronously (callRPC) and started (startRPC).

3. Data Services: You can create java Data Services that supply data on demand to Gsi Data Serviced Variables defined in G2.

Data types in RPC calls between G2 and Java are converted automatically;

When G2 calls a method in a G2Gateway the parameters are converted as follows;

  • G2 INTEGER to Java int
  • G2 TEXT to Java String
  • G2 TRUTH-VALUE to boolean
  • G2 FLOAT to Java double
  • G2 SYMBOL to Java com.gensym.util.Symbol
  • G2 SEQUENCE to Java com.gensym.util.Sequence
  • G2 STRUCTURE to Java com.gensym.util.Structure
  • G2 ITEM to Java com.gensym.classes.Item ** (** All G2 System classes are defined as Java Stub classes in package com.gensym.classes. Additionally any KB user classes are also converted to Java stubs)

    When G2 embeds data within an array, sequence or structure, all primitive types will be object wrapped;

  • G2 INTEGER to Java Integer
  • G2 TRUTH-VALUE to Java Boolean
  • G2 FLOAT to Java Double

    The following Java datatypes are automatically converted to G2 ITEMs or VALUEs when sent back to G2 via a RPC call (see CallRPC...) even when embedded in Sequences, Structures, Attributes of Items, Arrays or Lists;

  • Java Integer to G2 INTEGER
  • Java String to G2 TEXT
  • Java Boolean to G2 TRUTH-VALUE
  • Java Double to G2 FLOAT
  • Java Byte to G2 INTEGER
  • Java Character to G2 TEXT(of one char)
  • Java Float to G2 FLOAT
  • Java Short to G2 INTEGER
  • Java Long to G2 INTEGER(first 31 bits)
  • Java com.gensym.util.Symbol to G2 SYMBOL
  • Java com.gensym.util.Sequence to G2 SEQUENCE
  • Java com.gensym.util.Structure to G2 STRUCTURE
  • Java com.gensym.util.Item to G2 ITEM (and any subclasses of etc...)
  • Java Object[] to G2 G2-ARRAY
  • Java boolean[] to G2 TRUTH-VALUE-ARRAY
  • Java Symbol[] to G2 SYMBOL-ARRAY
  • Java String[] to G2 TEXT-ARRAY
  • Java Number[] to G2 QUANTITY-ARRAY
  • Java double[] to G2 FLOAT-ARRAY
  • Java int[] to G2 INTEGER-ARRAY

    Note: The conversion to and from primitive Java arrays is very efficient.

    Callbacks generated from communication with G2 cause events to be sent to any G2ConnectionListeners. These events are generated under predefined conditions;

  • The connected G2 has resumed.
  • The connected G2 has paused.
  • The connected G2 has send a message (VIA INFORM THE...)
  • The connection to G2 has been closed.
  • A connection to G2 has just been established.
  • A communicationError has occured while the connection to a G2 is active.
  • A communication error has occured, but no connection is active.
  • The network cannot deliver data that Java is attempting to write to G2.
  • The network cannot deliver data that G2 is attempting to write to Java.

    A G2ConnectionListener can register interest in these events by calling addG2ConnectionListener and can remove interest by calling removeG2ConnectionListener.

    A G2Gateway can only be connected to one G2 at any one time. If multiple connections are required within a Java application, then multiple G2Gateway's must be created. However, a G2Gateway can reconnect to another G2 on the network. Note, when a G2Gateway reconnects to another G2, Remote Procedures must be redeclared for the new connection.

    Any G2 can attempt to make an unsolicited connection to Java, but the connection must be accepted by an installed G2ConnectionHandlerFactory. The static method setG2ConnectionHandlerFactory allows a G2ConnectionHandlerFactory instance to select/create a G2Connection for any unsolicited G2 connections.

    G2Gateway has been designed to allow multiple Java threads to access a Java connection.

    See Also:
    G2Connection, Item, G2ConnectionHandlerFactory, G2ConnectionListener

    LISTENER_PORT_OPTION

    public static final String LISTENER_PORT_OPTION
    Command line option for specifing a TCPIP Listener port from which JavaLink will listener for incoming G2 connections. Follow this command with a valid TCPIP port number (e.g. 22045). The default listener port for JavaLink is 22041.

    NO_LISTENER_OPTION

    public static final String NO_LISTENER_OPTION
    Command line option for specifing that there is no Listener port from which JavaLink will listen for incoming G2 connections. JavaLink can connect to G2, but G2 will not be able to initiate a connection with JavaLink

    G2_MINIMUM_VERSION

    public static final G2Version G2_MINIMUM_VERSION
    The oldest version of G2 at the other end of a G2Gateway connection. This can change on every release of JavaLink.

    DEFAULT_TWO_TIER_CLASS_NAME

    public static final String DEFAULT_TWO_TIER_CLASS_NAME
    The name of the class used for the Gateway on the second tier if no class is specified explicitly in the G2ConnectionInfo.

    public static final String DEFAULT_RMI_CLASS_NAME

    startup

    public static void startup()
    Startup the G2 Communications Gateway allowing G2Gateway to connect and communicate with G2 and listen for unsolicited connections from G2 servers (unsolicited connections are only accepted if a G2ConnectionFactory has been installed). G2 Connections made via getOrMakeConnection will automatically startup the G2 Communications if not already started.
    See Also:
    getOrMakeConnection(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), setConnectionHandlerFactory(com.gensym.jgi.G2ConnectionHandlerFactory)

    setConnectionHandlerFactory

    public static void setConnectionHandlerFactory(G2ConnectionHandlerFactory fac)
    Sets the G2ConnectionHandlerFactory of an application.

    It can be called at most once by an application. A G2ConnectionHandlerFactory is responsible for selecting an appropriate G2Connection for an incomming unsolicited (g2 initiated) G2 connection.

    Throws an Error if the factory has already been defined.

    Parameters:
    fac - the desired factory.

    returnMessage

    public void returnMessage(String message)
    Return a message to the connected G2.

    The message text is sent to the MESSAGE-BOARD item in the current KB of the connected G2.

    Parameters:
    message - the message to send to G2's message board.

    closeConnection

    public void closeConnection()
    Close an active connection with a G2. The connection is not alive after this point. Any attempts to call RPCs through this Gateway will fail.
    See Also:
    isAlive()

    isAlive

    public boolean isAlive()
    Determines if this Gateway can be used for RPC calls to G2 or not. It will return true once it has initialized properly and until it is closed (either by a method call or from the server).
    Returns:
    boolean true if it is OK to call RPCs through this Gateway, false otherwise
    See Also:
    closeConnection()

    registerJavaMethod

    public void registerJavaMethod(Object target,
                               String method_name,
                               Symbol g2_RPD_name)
    Register a method of a Java object, so that it can be called by a connected G2. This method declares that when G2 CALLS or STARTS a specified REMOTE-PROCEDURE-DECLARATION (RPD) across a GSI connection to Javalink then G2Gateway will attempt to call [target].[method_name](params_from_G2_call...). G2Gateway will call method_name with the number and type of parameters sent from G2 during the G2 RPC call. If target does not have the corresponding method_name with the correct parameter signature then G2Gateway will raise a java.lang.NoSuchMethodException. Note: For the most optimal performance, it is recommended that Methods are registered with the second variant of this method, where a java.lang.reflect.Method is registered instead of a method String. This saves significant time, as G2Gateway does not need to lookup the registered method each time. However, by registering a method with a string allows G2Gateway to dynamically dispatch a method call based on the method name and the parameters sent from G2.
    Parameters:
    target - The object on which the method is to be called.
    method_name - The method to made visible.
    g2_RPD_name - The G2 REMOTE-PROCEDURE-DECLARATION name to be associated with method_name for target.
    Throws:
    DuplicateLocalRPCException - When g2_RPD_name has already been declared as a G2 RPC.

    registerJavaMethod

    public void registerJavaMethod(Object target,
                               Method java_method,
                               Symbol g2_RPD_name,
                               boolean call_in_new_thread)
    Register a pre-looked-up Method of a Java object, so that it can be called by a connected G2. This method declares that when G2 CALLS or STARTS a specified REMOTE-PROCEDURE-DECLARATION (RPD) across a GSI-INTERFACE(connected to JAVALINK) then G2Gateway will attempt to call [target].[java_method](params...) registered for the RPD name using registerJavaMethod. Note, G2Gateway will call java_method with the number and type of parameters sent from G2 during the G2 RPC call. If java_method does not have the correct parameter signature then G2Gateway will raise a java.lang.NoSuchMethodException.
    Parameters:
    target - The object on which the method is to be called.
    java_method - The method to made visible.
    g2_RPD_name - The G2 REMOTE-PROCEDURE-DECLARATION name to be associated with method_name for target.
    call_in_new_thread - Set true to create a new thread for the execution of the method otherwise a G2 RPC call to Java will be queued with all other method calls for this G2Connection.
    Throws:
    DuplicateLocalRPCException - When g2_RPD_name has already been declared as a G2 RPC.

    callRPC

    public Object callRPC(Symbol g2_procedure_name,
                      Object[] args)
               throws G2AccessException
    Call a predeclared G2 procedure/method synchronously (wait until then call returned or a timeout). The current thread will wait until the remote G2 has executed.

    To call a G2 method the first argument in args must be a G2 Item of the appropriate class.

    Parameters:
    g2_procedure_name - The predeclared G2 procedure to call.
    args - The Object array to pass to the G2 procedure/method as its arguments.
    Returns:
    The result of the G2 procedure/method.
    Throws:
    G2AccessException - when a problem occurs as a result of calling this RPC in G2.
    TimeoutException - if the RPC takes longer than the default timeout period.

    callRPC

    public Object callRPC(Symbol g2_procedure_name,
                      Object[] args,
                      int timeout)
               throws G2AccessException
    Call a predeclared G2 procedure/method synchronously (wait until the call returned or a timeout) The current thread will wait until the remote G2 has executed.

    To call a G2 method the first argument in args must be a G2 Item of the appropriate class.

    Parameters:
    g2_procedure_name - The predeclared G2 procedure/method to call.
    args - The Object array to pass to the G2 procedure/method as its arguments.
    timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the return, 0 for indefinite.
    Returns:
    The result of the G2 procedure/method.
    Throws:
    G2AccessException - when a problem occurs as a result of calling this RPC in G2.
    TimeoutException - if the the RPC takes longer than the timeout period.

    startRPC

    public void startRPC(Symbol g2_procedure_name,
                     Object[] args)
    Start a predeclared remote G2 procedure, ignore any return values. The method returns immediately.
    Parameters:
    g2_procedure_name - The G2 procedure to call.
    args - The array of objects to pass as arguments.

    canCallRPC

    public boolean canCallRPC()
    Indicates whether this thread can successfully call an RPC synchronously If this call returns false, then a call to callRPC will throw an Exception.
    Returns:
    true if synchronous RPC calls are allowed in the current Thread, false otherwise.

    setRemoteRPCReturnKind

    public void setRemoteRPCReturnKind(Symbol g2_procedure_name,
                                   int return_value_type)
    Set the value type of the return type of an Item from a remote RPC call. G2 Items are returned BY_HANDLE by default in JavaLink.
    Parameters:
    g2_procedure_name - The name of the procedure
    return_value_type - either PASS_BY_COPY or PASS_BY_HANDLE

    getG2ConnectionInfo

    public G2ConnectionInfo getG2ConnectionInfo()
    Returns a G2ConnectionInfo object that contains the information that specifies the details of the Gateway's connection profile with G2.

    setConnectionInfo

    protected void setConnectionInfo(G2ConnectionInfo info)
    Set the default connection info for this connection.
    Parameters:
    The - new default G2ConnectionInfo

    initiateConnection

    protected boolean initiateConnection(G2ConnectionInfo info)
                              throws ConnectionTimedOutException,
                                     G2AccessInitiationException
    Try to initiate connection with a remote G2 process.

    If the G2Gateway succeeds in establishing a connection with the remote G2, then a new GSI-INTERFACE is created within G2. If the connection is successful, then the conenction will inform all its G2ConnectionListeners of a G2_CONNECTION_INITIALIZED event.

    Parameters:
    info - The G2ConnectionInfo defining the connection
    timeout - The length of time to wait for the connection
    Returns:
    true if a connection was initiated successfully
    Throws:
    ConnectionTimedOutException - If the connection takes longer than timeout
    G2AccessInitiationException - If the connection could not be initiated for some reason

    g2getVersionStructure

    public Structure g2getVersionStructure()
                                throws G2AccessException
    Returns the version information for the G2 that we are connected to. This includes the software version, release level, and build identifier.
    Returns:
    a Structure describing the remote G2 version.

    g2getBuildVersion

    public String g2getBuildVersion()
                         throws G2AccessException
    Returns the build identification string for the G2 that we are connected to. This includes the software version, platform, and the build identifier.
    Returns:
    a String describing the remote G2 version.

    getMinimumVersion

    public G2Version getMinimumVersion()
    Returns the mininum version of G2 that we are allowed to make a connection to. This can be overriden by subclasses to indicate that those type of connections may only be made to newer versions of G2. It is not a good idea to specify an version older than that specified by a superclass.
    Returns:
    a G2Version describing the oldest G2 we expect to talk to

    Returns the FIRST connection whose G2ConnectionInfo matches() the given G2ConnectionInfo.
    See Also:
    G2ConnectionInfo.matches(com.gensym.jgi.G2ConnectionInfo)

    getOrMakeConnection

    public static G2Connection getOrMakeConnection(String host,
                                               String port)
                                        throws ConnectionTimedOutException,
                                               G2AccessInitiationException
    Looks for a connection with a given "profile" and returns it, if found. otherwise, creates a new connection and initiates the connection.
    Throws:
    ConnectionTimedOutException - when a new connection is not initiated within the default timeout
    G2AccessInitiationException - Indicates some error occured during the connection attempt.

    getOrMakeConnection

    public static G2Connection getOrMakeConnection(String brokerURL,
                                               String host,
                                               String port)
                                        throws ConnectionTimedOutException,
                                               G2AccessInitiationException
    Looks for or creates a connection with given url, host, and port. A newly created connection connects to the broker specified by brokerURL, then requests that broker to connect to the G2 on host that is listening at port. Currently, the host is resolved by the broker, not by the client.
    Throws:
    ConnectionTimedOutException - when a new connection is not initiated within the default timeout
    G2AccessInitiationException - Indicates some error occured during the connection attempt.

    getOrMakeConnection

    public static G2Connection getOrMakeConnection(G2ConnectionInfo info)
                                        throws G2AccessInitiationException,
                                               ConnectionTimedOutException
    Looks for a connection with a given "profile" and returns it, if found. otherwise, creates a new connection and initiates the connection.
    Throws:
    ConnectionTimedOutException - when a new connection is not initiated within the default timeout
    G2AccessInitiationException - Indicates some error occured during the connection attempt.
    See Also:
    G2ConnectionInfo

    chooseConnectionImplClass

    protected static Class chooseConnectionImplClass(G2ConnectionInfo info)
                                          throws ClassNotFoundException
    Returns a subclass of G2Gateway, the choice of which is based on the className and protocol of the G2ConnectionInfo object. The Class object returned by this method must satisfy G2Gateway.class.isAssignableFrom(returnValue). Otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
    Throws:
    ClassNotFoundException - If the subClass can not be found

    Finds any stored connections that match with info. Currently this is a linear search.

    See Also:

    storeOpenConnection

    Stores the open connection in a place that can be found by findOpenConnection

    preloadG2Classes

    public void preloadG2Classes(Symbol[] g2ClassNames,
                             boolean createThread)
    This method will preload and initialize a given array of G2 classes. Loading and initializing G2 classes can sometimes be time consuming. This method can be used to preload a number of known classes (optionally within an independent thread).
    Parameters:
    g2ClassNames - An array of known G2 class names to load
    createThread - set true to preload in an independent thread

    initializeLocalRPCs

    protected void initializeLocalRPCs()
    Initialize all Local RPC's used for this class connection. This method will only be called once just before the first G2InitializeConnection is called for a connection to this class

    initializeConnectionRPCs

    protected void initializeConnectionRPCs()
    Initialize all Remote G2 RPC's needed for a connection. This method will be called just before G2InitializeConnection is called. Users should never need to call this directly. NOTE: Subclasses who override this method must call super.initializeConnectionRPCs()

    Parameters:

    Throws:

    getG2ProxyForJavaObject

    public Item getG2ProxyForJavaObject(String g2ProxyClass,
                                    Symbol g2ParentClass,
                                    Object javaObject)
                             throws G2AccessException
    Return an Item that represents a G2 ITEM that is a proxy for a Java Object.
    Parameters:
    g2ProxyClass - the G2 Class name, used to create an instance of a proxy in the event that an existing proxy could not be found. Set null to use the default G2 Class registered for the class of JavaObject.
    g2ParentClass - the G2 class created that will inherit from this G2 Class
    javaObject - the Java Object to create a proxy for.
    Throws:
    G2AccessException - When there is a problem communicating with G2 or a G2 Class could not be found to create the proxy ITEM

    public Item getUniqueNamedItem(Symbol itmClass,
                               Symbol itmName)
                        throws G2AccessException

    itmName - the name of the Item
    Returns:
    the requested Item
    Throws:

    Returns:
    the requested Item
    Throws:

    getAttributeDescriptions

    public Sequence getAttributeDescriptions(Symbol className,
                                         Sequence attributeNames)
                                  throws G2AccessException
    Returns a Sequence of structures describing each attribute of the class (See Attribute Export for details of the format of this information)
    Parameters:
    className - a Symbol naming the G2 class
    attributeNames - a Sequence of symbols naming attributes of className for which to retreive attribute descriptions. A zero length Sequence may be passed in to retreive the descriptions of all attributes.
    Returns:
    A Sequence containing structures, each of which is a description of an attribute of the class.

    getG2State

    public Symbol getG2State()
                  throws G2AccessException
    Returns the current run state of G2.
    Returns:
    a symbol that is one of RUNNING, PAUSED, or RESET
    Throws:
    G2AccessException - if any error occurs during communication with G2
    See Also:
    setG2State(com.gensym.util.Symbol), RUNNING_, PAUSED_, RESET_

    setG2State

    public Symbol setG2State(Symbol newState)
                  throws G2AccessException
    Sets the run state of G2. In order to restart G2, first change to RESET then change to RUNNING.
    Parameters:
    the - desired new state of G2. This should be one of the following Symbols - RUNNING, PAUSED, or RESET
    Throws:
    G2AccessException - if any error occurs during communication with G2
    See Also:
    getG2State(), RUNNING_, PAUSED_, RESET_

    getStrictInstancesOfClass

    public Sequence getStrictInstancesOfClass(Symbol g2ClassName_)
                                   throws G2AccessException
    Retreives all strict instances of a given class. In other words, given a class A and its subclass B, assuming instances of both A A and B exist in the KB, getStrictInstancesOfClass (A) will not include instances of B. In order to gather all instances of a class including subclasses, use getDirectSubClasses and call getStrictInstances recursively.
    Parameters:
    g2ClassName_ - a Symbol naming a class
    Returns:
    a Sequence of 0 or more Items of the class g2ClassName_
    Throws:
    G2AccessException - if there any errors during communication or within the call
    See Also:
    #getDirectSubClasses

    getDirectSubclasses

    public Sequence getDirectSubclasses(Symbol g2ClassName_)
                             throws G2AccessException
    Retreives the names of all direct subclasses of a given class. Use this method recursively to gather all subclasses of a given class.
    Parameters:
    g2ClassName_ - a Symbol naming a class
    Returns:
    a Sequence of Symbols naming the direct subclasses
    Throws:
    G2AccessException - if there any errors during communication or within the call
